intro: Sida contermina, commonly known as the woolly sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features small, yellow flowers and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Sida contermina is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
